page.title: 08The effects of the war
page.content:
There were three bombs dropped on Redcar during the war. One of the bombs came to land on the Zetland Club killing the Mayor of Redcar, some councillors and other prominent citizens. If it had not been for a special Council meeting many more councillors would have been killed as they frequently met in the Club.
Ten years after the war the site was made into an ornamental garden. The garden stands out because the road consists of terraced houses with no gardens.
Opposite the garden, on the site of the old Council Offices, is the town's War Memorial.
